title: How to use multiple apps at a time if my device doesn't have an in-built split screen feature - Quora

response.answer_text: If you're using Android, you can try Jtouch app which is like a floating button to quickly switch back n forth between last used app. You may also try floating apps which allows opening a predefined set of apps like calculator, YouTube, browser, notepad etc. to open on top of your current app as a floating window best part is you're not restricted to one app. Only limit is your RAM and processing power. Both of the above apps are available in play store. Good luck n peace.
